td.content: s:patient with severe weight loss, severe dyspnea and mild shortness of breath. he has had several such episodes over past 8 months. pt is a white m aged 65 Ys. patient reports that he smokes once or twice daily he is a heavy drinker o:Height 191 cm, Weight 83.2 kg, Temperature 36.6 C, Pulse 82, SystolicBP 108, DiastolicBP 67, Respiration 15, CT chest shows a presence of a right upper lobe mass, along with mediastinal lymphadenopathy and multiple small pulmonary metastases, Bone Scan showed increased uptake in the proximal phalanx of right ring finger and likely metastatic deposits in T9 vertebrae and several ribs, Biopsy of the finger showed moderately to poorly differentiated metastatic adenocarcinoma in keeping with lung origin a:Lung Cancer p:administered cisplatin - 60 mg/m2 3 times per month, irinotecan - 60 mg/m2 3 times per month, performed CT chest, Bone Scan, Biopsy of the finger, and performed E/M Emergency Services Level 3 - Completed.
